dt: {bc}a solemn chant (such as a dirge) for the repose of the dead
{bc}something that resembles such a solemn chant
{bc}a musical setting of the mass for the dead
{bc}a musical composition in honor of the dead

et: Middle English, from Latin (first word of the introit of the requiem mass), accusative of {it}requies{/it} rest, from {it}re-{/it} + {it}quies{/it} quiet, rest {ma}{mat|while|}{/ma}
shortdef: a solemn chant (such as a dirge) for the repose of the dead
something that resembles such a solemn chant

dt: {bc}any of a family (Carcharhinidae) of sharks (such as the {d_link|tiger shark|tiger shark} or {d_link|blue shark|blue shark}) that are found in tropical and temperate waters, are usually gray to brown above and yellow to white below, have a rounded snout with bladelike teeth, and include some that have been known to attack people

et: obsolete French {it}requiem{/it} shark, alteration of French {it}requin{/it}
shortdef: any of a family (Carcharhinidae) of sharks (such as the tiger shark or blue shark) that are found in tropical and temperate waters, are usually gray to brown above and yellow to white below, have a rounded snout with bladelike teeth, and include some that have been known to attack people
